title: 20 Chess Books - November 2015 (gnv64)
description:
A collection of 20 chess books, 17 are in PDF format, 2 in ePUB and 1 in DJVU:


01. 200 Perplexing Chess Puzzles by Martin Greif
02. A Guide to Chess Endings by Max Euwe
03. A Killer Chess Opening Repertoire by Aaron Summerscale
04. Attacking Technique by Colin Crouch
05. Chess Tactics from Scratch (2nd Ed) by Martin Weteschnik
06. Concise Chess Middlegames by Neil McDonald
07. Danger In Chess -  How to Avoid Making Blunders Amatzia Avni
08. Grandmaster Preparation - Strategic Play by Jacob Aagaard
09. Improve Your Middlegame by Andrew Kinsman
10. Korchnoi's Chess Games by Levi & O'Connell
11. Mastering the King's Indian Defense by Robert Bellin, Pietro Ponzetto
12. Modern Ideas in Chess by Richard Reti
13. Play 1 b4! - Shock your opponents with the Sokolsky by Lapschun & Contichello
14. Studying Chess Made Easy by Andrew Soltis
15. Tactical Play by Mark Dvoretsky
16. The Chess Mysteries of Sherlock Holmes by Raymond Smullyan
17. The Classical King's Indian by John Nunn
18. The Dynamic English by Tony Kosten
19. Win at Chess by Ron Curry
20. Winning With the Hypermodern by David Norwood
